alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 1:02AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL SULLIVAN...EAST CENTRAL WAYNE AND NORTH CENTRAL PIKE COUNTIES THROUGH 130 AM EDT... At 101 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Narrowsburg, or 12 miles east of Honesdale, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Fallsburg, Monticello, Lackawaxen, Liberty, Bethel, Neversink, South Fallsburg, Tusten, Hawley, and Woodridge. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 99 and 111. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
